fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64358].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA uses XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence in four ways:
 # Retrieve lists of spaces from the instance.
 # Search for content in the instance (globally or by space).
 # Given a {{pageId}}, retrieve page titles and urls for Confluence content.
 # Given a URL, retrieve a {{pageId}} for what is assumed to be Confluence content.

JIRA should use Confluence's REST API to achieve (4).

This aims to resolve a number of issues related to successful retrieval of page info – e.g., when page titles include special characters in them.
fields.summary: Improve the lookup of Confluence content IDs when linking them in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64357].
  {panel}

Currently, JIRA uses XMLRPC to communicate with Confluence in four ways:
 # Retrieve lists of spaces from the instance.
 # Search for content in the instance (globally or by space).
 # Given a {{pageId}}, retrieve page titles and urls for Confluence content.
 # Given a URL, retrieve a {{pageId}} for what is assumed to be Confluence content.

JIRA should use Confluence's REST API to achieve (1). This would:
 * Relieve pressure on Confluence, because the XMLRPC API returns *all* spaces in the instance at once.
 * Open up the possibility of implementing an autocomplete component, letting users type to find the specific space they want to search.
 * Open up the possibility of searching within *multiple spaces* instead of just a single one, should this be desirable to do.
fields.summary: Use Confluence's REST API to search for and filter spaces
Login Page tab button should tab to "next" button rather than Privacy Policy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64351].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Long comments in JIRA can cause performance problems as investigated on [JRA-28519|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28519]
There is a jira.text.field.character.limit set to 32767 by default in JIRA Cloud.
This prevents the saving of a comment with a message: 
{quote}
The entered text is too long. It exceeds the allowed limit of 32767 characters.
{quote}

At that point the user needs to either remove characters or copy the text already formatted on the comment to a text file, save it locally and attach it to the issue.

h3. Suggestion
Provide a full user friendly alternative when saving comments that go over the limit to improve the speed and convenience.

h3. An idea:
JIRA prompts to save the long text in an attachment.
Example:
{quote}
The entered text is too long. Would you like us to create a file attachment with text inside the text blocks?
{quote}
JIRA then parse the \{code\} and \{noformat\} text into a .txt file and attaches it to the issue.
Then it adds the comment with the text that was outside the blocks, adds a preview of the blocks text and a link to the attachment containing the full text. If multiple blocks are find, then it does a different file for each one.

h3. More info
This has been previously asked/requested on:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/16392971/what-is-the-best-way-to-hide-large-text-in-jira-issue-description
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59124
fields.summary: Provide a full solution for long comments breaching the character limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64347].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
For each user login event JIRA flushes number of cached: *activeUsersCount*, *activeUsersCountForLicense*, *licenseRoleGroups*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable cache-flush event logging
# Login to JIRA

h3. Expected Results
No cache flush events 

h3. Actual Results
Caches are flushed. The below exception is thrown in the logs:
{noformat}
2017-03-08 15:59:04,879 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,892 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,896 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount] Cache com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,899 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,904 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,905 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount] Cache com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,913 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,914 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,915 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount] Cache com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,922 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,924 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,925 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount] Cache com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,933 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.licenseRoleGroups was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,934 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense] Cache com.atlassian.jira.license.DefaultLicenseRoleManager.activeUsersCountForLicense was flushed. Stacktrace:
2017-03-08 15:59:04,935 http-bio-8080-exec-8 INFO anonymous 959x1050x1 19iqhul 127.0.0.1 /login.jsp [user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount] Cache com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.activeUsersCount was flushed. Stacktrace:
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Those 3 caches a very important and required for almost any incoming http call. 
In JIRA 7 license count framework was changed and problem was fixed. 

h3.Workaround
If possible, reduce number of login events
* For *REST* API use session cookie
* For SOAP, login and reuse session, see https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Remote+API+(SOAP)+Examples
fields.summary: JIRA flushed cache licenseRoleGroups activeUsersCountForLicense and activeUsersCount the for each user login
Who is currently logged into Jira?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64338].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Attachment not shown in JIRA Server after migrating to JIRA Server.

* Problem happens because Cloud instance shows *filesize-0* from the issue page. 
* Attachment affected by this problem will also shows *filesize=0* in Cloud instance's fileattachment table.
* Since the value of the filesize is saved as *0* in database, the filesize will be saved as 0 in entites.xml generated for JIRA Server migration.


h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud and JIRA Server 7.3.2


h3. Expected Results

JIRA Cloud saves the exact size of the attachment (in bytes) in fileattachment's filesize column. This will ensure that the backup generated for JIRA Server containes the right values for all the attachments.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA Cloud saves some attachment with 0 bytes fileattachment's filesize column. 


h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Attachment problem after migrating from JIRA Cloud to Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64336].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When clicking the link Run search without smart query, the results of the query changes, but the JQL in the Advanced search box doesn't change. 
h3. Environment
- Affects both Cloud and Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter "my foo*"(without quotes) in the Search box at the top of the page, and switch to Advanced search where you can see the JQL. See img1
 # Click the pop-up link to Run search without smart query.  Notice that the results change, but the JQL stays the same. See img2

h3. Expected Results

After clicking the Run search without smart query link, the JQL query should change to text ~ "my foo*"
h3. Actual Results

After clicking the Run search without smart query link, the JQL query in the search box stays as assignee=currentUser() AND text ~ "foo*"

But the URL in the browser will update to display the appropriate search i.e.:
{code}
https://<BASE_URL>.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123/?jql=text~"my%20foo"
{code}
 
h3.  Workaround
Refresh the page and the actual JQL search being used will be displayed in the search box
fields.summary: Run search without smart query doesn't change JQL query in Advanced search box

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64335].
  {panel}

*Summary*

Cannot perform a bulk operation when selecting a default filter, such as _My open issues_ and _Reported by me_.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Go to *Issues > My open issues*.
# Click on the three dots option, _Change all issue(s)_.

*Expected Results*

The screen should show an option to select the bulk change you want to perform.

*Actual Results*

Backs to _My open issues_ filter.

*Workaround*

Any change in the query of the filter makes it possible to perform the bulk change.
fields.summary: Cannot perform a bulk operation when selecting a default filter
Option to create linked space while creating project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64331].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA is not explicitly selecting a GC method to use. Most JIRA Server instances are using the oldparallel method or Concurrent (CMS) methods to handle the JAVA garbage collection.
h3. Suggested Solution

By default, JIRA should come with the {{-XX:+UseG1GC}} JVM startup parameter.
h3. Why this is important
 * Improved performance on environments with large heaps
 * consistent GC method across initial deployments

h3. Workaround

JIRA Admins are able to manually enable the G1GC method by following the steps in [Setting properties and options on startup - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Setting+properties+and+options+on+startup] and adding the parameter of {{-XX:+UseG1GC}} to the *JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=* section.
fields.summary: Ship JIRA with G1GC enabled by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64330].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to set fields to read only from the view issue screen. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow ability to restrict field edits from the view issue screen. 

h3. Why this is important
 By restricting the ability to edit from view issue. It can help avoid users entering erroneous data.
fields.summary: Allow fields to be read only.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64329].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA issue key is generated sequentially, customer wants to prevent user from seeing how many tickets are there in JIRA instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA to use a randomly generated number for issue key in order to hide the actual number of tickets.

h3. Why this is important
For security reasons, some customer needs to hide this information from their user/customer.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to use a random number in issue key
Migrate from Cloud to Server documentation should inform the user that they can restore data without having to perform it in the setup stage only
Collapse Backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64326].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In some cases JIRA *CaesiumScheduler* can create more then single record in {{clusteredjob}} table. 
This will lead to problems similar to one in JRA-64325: method {{getJobDetails}} expects single uniq value from DB, while {{clusteredjob}} table does not ensure this.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# TBD

h3. Expected Results
Caesium ensures data integrity 

h3. Actual Results
*CaesiumScheduler* can create more then single record in {{clusteredjob}} table.

h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
* Delete duplicated records, see https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-fails-to-start-due-to-too-many-rows-found-for-query-on-clusteredjob-800702971.html
fields.summary: JIRA CaesiumSchedulerService can insert duplicated records into clusteredjob
add ticket number to subtask '...'+Resolve
Documentation for JIRA 7.3.0 End of support announcements should be updated
Add the possibility to handle emails bigger than 10MB in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64321].
  {panel}

 

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, this documentation provided ways on how to find SEN: https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/how-to-find-your-support-entitlement-number-sen-229840018.html

One option is to check it through System Information:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/how-to-find-your-support-entitlement-number-sen-229840018.html#HowtofindyourSupportEntitlementNumber(SEN)-Ifyou’reanadministratorwithproductaccess

System Information is only accessible through Server version

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a note on the document that the option to check SEN through System Information is only for the Server version.
fields.summary: Checking SEN in the instance is only available for Server instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64315].
  {panel}

We've got three worklog related clauses available for the JQL: 
* worklogDate
* worklogAuthor
* worklogratio

If we use the clause "worklogdate" or "worklogauthor"  instead of "worklogDate" or "worklogAuthor" , JIRA consider that is not using the default worklog clause and skip the query optimisation feature when constructing the lucene search query. The consequence makes that JIRA took a longer time to return the search result.
fields.summary: Worklog clause should not be case sensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64314].
  {panel}

When a project is created in JIRA and a linked Confluence Space is generated, a space shortcut to the JIRA Project automatically appears in the Confluence Space:
* !space_shortcut.png|thumbnail! 

However, there's no Project Shortcut to the Confluence Space created in the JIRA Project. To put it simply, as a user, we want Linked Spaces to show up (automatically) when I display
the Jira Project (sidebar).

For now, It seems like the only way to do this is adding linked space manually.
fields.summary: Automatically Create Project Shortcut to Linked Confluence Space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64312].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

User unable to add a comment in an issue when the URL of the issue contains ** e.g https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue key>**
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Browse to any issue in a project and '**' at the end of the issue URL => [https://abcd.atlassian.net/browse/AB-6**]
 * The page will reload with '**' not being remove from the URL
 * Add a comment to the issue and an error message window will pop-up

h3. Expected Results
 * User to be able to add a comment to the issue regardless the URL contains '**' or not

h3. Actual Results
 * User not able to add comment when the URL contains '**'
  
h3. Workaround

 * Remove '**' from the URL and user should be able to add a comment
fields.summary: Unable to add comment when URL contains '**'
Include Other Fields in Mail Handler Configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64310].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA, there is no keyboard shortcut defined for exporting issue (as printable, to Word etc.)

h3. Suggested Solution
Add keyboard shortcuts for exporting issues.
fields.summary: Add new keyboard shortcut for exporting issues
Components part of a ticket don't show on active sprint board
Nested groups documentation is confusing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64304].
  {panel}

We have a JIRA v7.3.2 install (sub-version #73013-sha1:3d53c97) with the visual/rich text editor enabled. The visual editor has caused frustration among my co-workers, as it encodes and displays literally text that we intended to be parsed as markdown or plug-in syntax (\{task\} for example). Unfortunately, the system defaults to Visual mode, and I can’t find a way to set it to default as Text. I notice that the Atlassian JIRA (which seems to be running v7.3.0 sub-version 73011-sha1:3202aba:node1) defaults to Text. I also understand that previous versions only had Text mode with a Preview button, which seems like a much better solution because there’s no chance of text transforming in unwanted ways when switching between what should be edit and preview modes.

We would like one or more of these options:
* Turn off the visual editor and use the old editor with Preview button.
* If the system has the visual editor enabled, choose whether to display text or visual mode by default.

These should be configurable by each user. If you want to provide a site/install-wide setting, fine, but the user should have the option to override in case the sysadmins choose the wrong one.
fields.summary: Visual Editor-enabled JIRA should allow users to default to text mode (via preference or just remembering last used mode)
Update to JIRA Core Labs Documentation Needed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64302].
  {panel}

*PROBLEM*
When using the JIRA cardwall, stories move across the status columns as the progress from new work to completed work. Users drag the cards from left to right during that progression. For an organization that has multiple "done" statuses (DONE, REJECTED / WON'T FIX, DUPLICATE, etc), all of those statuses appear in the "Done" column as you drag a card into that last status. The column is then divided into equal parts, vertically, with all of the available DONE statuses. The user is supposed to drag into the right DONE area for that story. 

The main problem with this approach is that most of the time, we really want to mark a story as Done or Completed. We almost never drag one into rejected, dup, etc. However, as testers are rushing to get through work at the end of a sprint, very often they drag a story into the wrong done status. This creates confusion and additional overhead on checking in with the team to confirm they meant DONE not REJECTED, etc. I find this to be one of the most irritating UX aspects to the cardwall.

 

*SUGGESTION*

Make dragging a story into the final "done" column easier to mark "DONE" instead of the myriad other statuses that share this visual space.
fields.summary: Improve UX of marking stories DONE on the cardwall

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64301].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It's no longer possible to create users with duplicated email addresses.

The instances that have duplicated email addresses are not able to import into other instances without updating the users.

 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the creation of users with duplicated email addresses, or skip the email validation during import.

 

h3. Why this is important

Some companies are unable to create an e-mail address for each user and so they need to create users with duplicated mail addresses

 

h3. Workaround (Optional)
fields.summary: Allow users with duplicated email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64300].
  {panel}

Right now, JIRAs REST API for update creation (see [REST update project|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/project-updateProject] ) does not allow to configure all the relevant schemes.

---

The following overview illustrates this: 
||REST Update Project attribute||supported||
|issueSecurityScheme|(/) can be set|
|permissionScheme|(/) can be set|
|notificationScheme|(/) can be set|
|workflowScheme|(x) can not be set|
|issueTypeScheme|(x) can not be set|
|issueTypeScreenScheme|(x) can not be set|
|fieldConfigurationScheme|(x) can not be set|

---

Workaround:

JIRA CLI Plugin can also update projects via scripting with flexibility of setting the schemes:
 [https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JCLI/Reference#Reference-updateProject]
fields.summary: JIRA REST API: update project should allow to set all relevant schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64299].
  {panel}

After some research around the FIlter Shared to Public, I found the JRA-23255, which mentions that new Settings are available in order allow or not to share Filter to Public, and make the difference between "Public" and "Logged In User".

Ok, it covers a part of the issue.

Is normal that, when an anonymous access list all Filters Shared to Public, it is possible to have have the name and login of the Filter's Owner.

The Question is more relevant when :
 * the JIRA Instance is in Private Mode
 * And the Browse Users Global Permission is granted to all groups.

In such case, the Owner should be not hidden.

Vincent
fields.summary: Shared Filter Owners should be not visible to anonymous access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64297].
  {panel}

I have modified a standard workflow "Software Simplified Workflow" and made one status ("In Review" in my example) unreachable. 
However the REST method "/jira/rest/projectconfig/1/workflow" still returns a JSON data that does not reflect this change: "In Review" status still exists there and has no principal difference with other statuses.
My problem is I have no way to check if it is actually available to switch to or not.
I suppose one of following solutions:
1. Remove unreachable states from JSON.
or
2. Mark unreachable states in JSON as disabled.
or
3. Mark the states that have transitions from "All" states with an appropriate tag.
fields.summary: Need an improvement in "/jira/rest/projectconfig/1/workflow" method.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64296].
  {panel}

As of JIRA Software 7.2.3 the Fix Version drop down on the issue screen only searches for typed text starting from the beginning of a whole word in a fix version. It would be nice if the list possibilities would be populated by versions which contained the input string in any part of the version. This behavior would be similar to how Bitbucket Server is able to populate a drop down list of branches matching the input text to any part of the branch name.

Example:

Say I have fix versions "hello1", "hello2", and "hello3" in my project. If I type "1" into the fix version field in an issue, currently the list possibilities will be empty and will only suggest that I can make a new fix version called "1". The desired behavior would be that the list possibilities contain "hello1" because the string "1" is contained in that fix version. 

The lack of more powerful searching in this drop down becomes a problem when a project has many versions, the version strings are long, and the characters that differentiate the versions are found at the end of a whole word so many characters must be typed before the desired version shows up as one of the top results in the drop down list.
fields.summary: Better searching in fix version dropdown on issue screen
Ability to change subject line on outgoing email type
JIRA iCalendar plugin support for 7.3.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64293].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
While on 'Basic' search, the 'Label' field should show as 'Labels' to be consistent with the rest of the application. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Rename the system field to 'Labels' in Basic Search

h3. Why this is important
The system field is named 'Labels', so it causes confusion when the field is rendered as 'Label' in Basic Search.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla 7.1.6 or newer instance
# Go to JIRA's basic search
# Notice the 'Labels' field is rendered as 'Label'
fields.summary: While on 'Basic' search, the 'Label' field should show as 'Labels' to be consistent with the system field/rest of the application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64281].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it isn't clear in the [Workflow Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/workflow-properties-802592825.html] documentation what [permissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-architecture/authentication/available-permissions] are available. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Please update the documentation with [available permissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-architecture/authentication/available-permissions]. 
h3. Why this is important
 Makes it easer and no user friction trying to dig for the information in developers.
fields.summary: Update workflow property documentation in regards to available permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64279].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Its not obvious from the documentation how to enable/disable the share functionality for specific users:
 * [Editing and collaborating on issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER073/Editing+and+collaborating+on+issues]
 * [Managing global permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Managing+global+permissions]

The *global permissions* screen does however mention this, but you would have to know it would be a *global permission* in the first place to get that far

!Screen Shot 2017-03-01 at 2.58.32 PM.png!
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add a note about the *Browse User* global permission in the share section of the [Editing and collaborating on issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER073/Editing+and+collaborating+on+issues] documentation
 * Add a note about the share feature (as exist in the global permission screen already) to the [Managing global permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Managing+global+permissions] documentation
fields.summary: Add note about global Browse Users permission to Share issue documentation.

Currently, JIRA only support MS SQL version up to 2014 only. Customer would like JIRA to officially support MS SQL 2016.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for MS SQL 2016

None

Hide Capture from menu bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64265].
  {panel}

Notification mails include a first line that provides links to project and issue itself. Something like...

_Some Project / ABC-456_

The same format is used for both parent issues and sub issues.

If the issue is a sub issue JIRA View screen shows the same information as 

Some Project / ABC-123 (subject line) / ABC-456 

 

Suggestion:

Make the notification emails also indicate that the issue (which is subject to the notification message) is a subtask of ABC-123(parent issue) with subject line.
fields.summary: Notification mails should indicate that the issue is a subtask
Send custom email to project members
Automatic notifications for changes in global or project-wise entities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64261].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using text effects in the middle of a word (like aaa{*}bbb{*}ccc) from the toolbar, the word is not marked up correctly.

When it comes to Non-English languages like Japanese, one sentence is composed *without* space character (as if it is a word) in general.

e.g.) The following sentences have the same meanings.
* English : I'm working for Atlassian. (There are some space character in the sentence)
* Japanese : 私は、アトラシアンで働いています。(There are no space character in the sentence)

When it comes to the Japanese one, If you want to make the word "アトラシアン" bold, we need to use text effects in the middle of the word (I meant the sentence *without* space character).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue
# Open the editor in the description field (comment field is also fine)
# Type "aaabbbccc" in the editor
# Try to make the part "bbb" of the word bold from the toolbar
# The word "aaabbbccc" is marked up as "aaa*bbb*ccc"
# Preview the description field (or comment field)

h3. Expected Results

For now, we can escape the special characters which are used for the text effects with "{}".
Then, the word "aaabbbccc" should be marked up as "aaa\{\*\}bbb\{\*\}ccc". (It was shown as "aaa{*}bbb{*}ccc".)

h3. Actual Results

As I described in the above, the word was converted to "aaa*bbb*ccc" and there was no text effect on the word. (It was shown as "aaa*bbb*ccc".)

h3.Workaround

Just type the mark up manually.
fields.summary: When using text effects in the middle of a word, the word is not marked up correctly
Allow Backlog to show Done tasks for inactive sprints
aggregate emails notifications for changes made in a small time period
Being able to delete and/or inactivate users who are project leads

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64255].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
This is not a JIRA bug, but the placeholder ticket for JVM problem. Main goal is to track the problem on our side.
Periodically JVM crashes with following error:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007f36c1177ae2, pid=26874, tid=0x00007f36a79da700
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_101-b13) (build 1.8.0_101-b13)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.101-b13 mixed mode linux-amd64 compressed oops)
# Problematic frame:
# V  [libjvm.so+0x5c3ae2]  G1ParScanThreadState::copy_to_survivor_space(InCSetState, oopDesc*, markOopDesc*)+0x1d2

...
Stack: [0x00007f36a78da000,0x00007f36a79db000],  sp=0x00007f36a79d9410,  free space=1021k
Native frames: (J=compiled Java code, j=interpreted, Vv=VM code, C=native code)
V  [libjvm.so+0x5c3ae2]  G1ParScanThreadState::copy_to_survivor_space(InCSetState, oopDesc*, markOopDesc*)+0x1d2
V  [libjvm.so+0x5c450b]  G1ParScanThreadState::trim_queue()+0x4ab
V  [libjvm.so+0x59ed17]  G1ParEvacuateFollowersClosure::do_void()+0x27
V  [libjvm.so+0x5aa923]  G1ParTask::work(unsigned int)+0x463
V  [libjvm.so+0xae5a6f]  GangWorker::loop()+0xcf
V  [libjvm.so+0x924698]  java_start(Thread*)+0x108
{code}

This is internal JVM error in *G1ParScanThreadState* code. 

h3. Environment 
* Oracle 8u101
** Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.101-b13) for linux-amd64 JRE (1.8.0_101-b13)

h3. Notes
There are some bugs open for this in Java bug tracker:
* https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8143310 

But unfortunately, they are closed as _Cannot Reproduce_. 
Commend from Oracle team: 
bq. This can be caused by any bug that corrupts heap memory. It could be an issue with GC, with the compiler, with bad native code...

h3.Workaround
Restart JVM/Jira
fields.summary: jvm crash  G1ParScanThreadState::copy_to_survivor_space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64254].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When importing to the issue tracker there isn't an option to map specific criteria for users. 
h3. Suggested Solution
When [JRA-40897|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40897] is fulfilled via the API allowing access to the users e-mail. Allow full import of user info. 
h3. Why this is important
 Currently this is a pain point as users have very basic functionality of the import and after taking the time to fill out criteria that exist in JIRA. There is unnecessary friction to capture the same information.
fields.summary: Allow the ability to specify user mapping during import.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64253].
  {panel}

h3. Definition
Whenever a user invite is being send out from the *Create User* page, debugged mail shows that the FROM address is actually the inviter's user email address and not the outgoing mail server address. This is not ideal for organizations where there's a security implemented to reject all other email addresses except for the outbound mail server address.

(!) All other notifications work fine. 

h3. Suggestion
Have the ability to invite an user using the outgoing mail server address rather than the inviter's email address.
fields.summary: User Invite Request to be Send Out by the Outgoing Mail server address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64252].
  {panel}

In the "releases" section in the left panel, there are only 3 quick filters : released, unreleased and archived.

Goal : filter versions just like the issues are filtered, and be able to create a report with individual versions only. 

Result example : See a table on Confluence with all recently released versions

I have a report table with all issues which fix version has been recently modified but there are too many issues with the same fix version for this report to be relevant
fields.summary: filter versions | create a versions report
Make enterprise-compatible application bundles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64245].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to Application Navigator.
 # Add a new entry. In the "Groups" field, search for a group.

h4. Expected results

JIRA returns matching group name, without any error.
h4. Actual results

JIRA returns matching group name, however, throws an error message on the page:
{quote}*Sorry, something went wrong. Your changes are not being saved.*
 Try refreshing the page. If the problem persists, please contact your System Administrator.
{quote}
The link is not created after adding it.
h4. Other info
 * This happens across Safari, Chrome, Firefox. Not tested on IE.
 * No error recorded in JIRA logs.
 * No error recorded in browser error console.

h4. Workaround

Add it without the group restriction
fields.summary: Application Navigator throws "Sorry, something went wrong. Your changes are not being saved." when searching for groups

Hello,

I cannot insert an image  in  Confluence,
 * When i click the Ask question button i couldn't  insert image from my local machine
 * I created the question without  image and when i Edit the question i still cannot  insert image.
 * Confluence version 5.7.3

I couldn't  create this issue as  a bug from my account in Jira, as i  have no  Assign issue  permission. Please could you look into this as  adding images when you ask  question(s) are  vital for  proper explanation of  the  issue(s). Please see also attached image.

Thanks,

Best  regards,

Moses.

 

!Error Message.PNG|width=702,height=382!
fields.summary: Un able to insert image

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64218].
  {panel}

This for JIRA Cloud

We use JIRA Portfolio's Parent Link field to link JIRA epics (SAFe Features) up to SAFe Epics (custom issue type). 

I need to be able to identify all issues based on their grandparent, and ideally on any other attribute of the JIRA Epic they belong to.

Either live in JQL as sub-queries, or some mechanism to (regularly or on request) to find them and label them so they can be found via that label search.

For example, I want to be able to have a board that showed all issues that were part of any epic whose Parent Link was a specific issue (SAFe Epic)... something like:

{{ "Epic Link" in ("Parent Link" = ABC-53)}}

This of course fails.

I've tried in Cloud using post-function based approaches (standard and JMWE), and have explored most of the add-ons available in cloud, but can't figure out how to do this.

 

This is *fundamental* in our SAFe adoption so we can show all the work supporting a particular SAFe Epic (which may be split across multiple Features in several release trains / programs, and across multiple teams). 

 

Please advise when some workaround of capability will be available in Cloud, or if this can be achieved through a cloud add-on or other approach.
fields.summary: Identify issues based on their Epic's Parent Link or other attribute (sub-queries ideally)
Seperate Permissions Group to add users to Jira Service Desk Cloud
New comments should not trigger "Issue Updated" webhook event.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Linked issue values are lost when different issue type / project is picked. New issue shares same create screen and Field config.
Linked issue values are not preserved when using Create another feature.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow linked issue values to maintain when different projects are picked. 
Automatically fill in the related issue type when Create new issue is clicked from project.
h3. Why this is important

To maintain a workflow of related linked issues.
fields.summary: Linked issues values are lost when different issue type or project is picked.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64211].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
All outgoing emails from JIRA will be sent from jira@example.atlassian.net. However, when using [Email Issue feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/emailing-an-issue-720416419.html], the email will be sent with the current user's email address as the sender. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Login to JIRA 
# Go to Issue Navigator to search for issue
# Click on the _Share_ feature 
#* !Screenshot from 2017-02-24 16-10-00.png|thumbnail! 
# Key in the recipient and _Share_

h3. Actual behavior
The email is sent by the current user email address instead of jira@example.atlassian.net:
 !Screenshot from 2017-02-24 16-28-26.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected behavior
The email should be sent by jira@example.atlassian.net


h3. Note: this is a regression of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27680
fields.summary: Current user's email being used as sender when sharing issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64209].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer uses the library (https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-rest-java-client) to integrate with JIRA. For some reason, the password is expired but Jira APIs still let users log in. When query for issues or any other calls, error 500 is returned.
h3. Suggested Solution
It should return a better error code, such as 401 (Authentication error).

h3. Why this is important
With the correct error code, it makes us easier to identify the root so we can fix it quicker instead wasting time on investigating the wrong area.
fields.summary: REST API returned Error 500 when password is expired

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64206].
  {panel}

When creating filters it is hard to see what project a task relates too.  The only option currently for a filter heading is the Project Name, but that can be long and cumbersome, and limits what you can sort by.

Please add the filter heading options of:
 * Project avatar
 * project type, and/or
 * project category

This would mean at a glance you can see what Project, or client it relates to, and provide the ability to sort by these headings.
fields.summary: Allow Project Details in Filter Columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64205].
  {panel}

*User Story:*
As a JIRA user using the keyboard shortcut to the _link_ feature to link issues between each other
I want the _Issue_ field to focused by default
So that I don't have to take my hands off the keyboard to select it with the mouse

*Notes:*
* Refer to the attached image
fields.summary: Auto focus Issue field when opening the link feature
How to add a button "Create Sub-task" on Main issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64203].
  {panel}

We're suggesting an improvement in the stack trace presented in the logs when we have the following scenario:
An user created a DVCS link between JIRA and GitHub but lather then, the JIRA user account that was used to create the link at JIRA, was not active anymore and this caused the message below:
{noformat}
017-02-12 14:17:03,718 Caesium-1-1 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.scheduler.core.JobLauncher] Scheduled job with ID 'com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsScheduler:job' failed
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.exception.SourceControlException: Error retrieving list of repositories
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.github.GithubCommunicator.getRepositories(GithubCommunicator.java:214)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.remote.CachingCommunicator.getRepositories(CachingCommunicator.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl.syncRepositoryList(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:205)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.RepositoryServiceImpl.syncRepositoryList(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:262)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.syncOrganizations(DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.scheduler.DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.runJob(DvcsSchedulerJobRunner.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:443)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:438)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJobWithRecoveryGuard(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:462)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:390)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:282)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.RequestException: Sorry. Your account was suspended. (403)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.GitHubClient.createException(GitHubClient.java:552)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.GitHubClient.get(GitHubClient.java:740)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.client.PageIterator.next(PageIterator.java:173)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.GitHubService.getAll(GitHubService.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.egit.github.core.service.RepositoryService.getRepositories(RepositoryService.java:242)
	... 18 more
{noformat}

Checking further, I found this article: [When refreshing the GitHub list it gives an Error when refreshing account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/when-refreshing-the-github-list-it-gives-an-error-when-refreshing-account-644579742.html].

It would be helpful if we improve this message to be more clear and state that the account which was suspended is the JIRA user account.
fields.summary: DVCS Sync improvement request in the stack trace

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64198].
  {panel}

*Problem:*

To distinguish ownership and handling of boards with similar names (we have quite a few) a custom description field for a board would be nice. Alternative we have to remember intricate naming schemes to know, if one department or the other should maintain/prioritize a board. It would be easier to read a description.

 

It could be displayed on the Board overview somewhere (see image).

 

!image-2017-02-23-09-44-59-068.png!
fields.summary: Add description field to the Board view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64197].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Database statistics about the basic information of Jira such as number of attachments, number of projects, number of issues, etc are not showing on Jira Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please include the Database Statistics like "System Information" page on Jira Server. Eg:
 !JIRA Database Statistic.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
* Admin can estimate the growth/usage of the instance by comparing the statistics monthly
* Admin can validate the data after a restoration/migration

{panel:title=Original request}
h3. Summary
Introduce Project statistics counter and Instance current size for administrators to keep track since system information are no longer available to view (see [JRA-63408|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63408])

eg. Numbers of Projects, Fields, Issues, etc
 !JIRA Database Statistic.png|thumbnail! 
{panel}
fields.summary: Project statistics counts for administrators
Allow administrators to access 'Safe-Mode' in Universal Plugin Manager

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64194].
  {panel}

!Screen Shot 2017-02-22 at 2.57.52 PM.png!

 

At least at my company, this is the current automatic avatar. It would be awesome to have it be something less traditionally masculine- currently thinking up what gender neutral avatars exist in the world (there are a bunch of vectors here: [https://image.freepik.com/free-vector/man-and-woman-avatars_23-2147506087.jpg|https://image.freepik.com/free-vector/man-and-woman-avatars_23-2147506087.jpg)]). Otherwise, I think a lot of organizations neatly sidestep this issue by having animal or abstract avatars.

 

Thank you kindly, you do good work! :)

 

I guessed on the components, sorry if they are wrongly categorized.
fields.summary: Female and/or Gender Neutral Avatar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64189].
  {panel}

*Problem Statement*

Currently, when using {{rest/api/2/search}} to get information about the projects from issues that are returned in the query, it's not possible to get just the project name or the project key from the issues. By filtering for the {{project}} field, all information from the project will show up.

*Suggested Resolution*

Allow users to specify which information from the project will return on the REST call
fields.summary: Allow users to query for specific fields under project on REST API
Ability to unlock system field, to Configure it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64186].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the value {{transaction-isolation}} is not being highlighted in the official documentation for JIRA.

For Confluence, the documentation has been updated; [Database Setup For MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-mysql-128747.html].

h3. Suggested Solution
Update JIRA documentation; for example, the latest one is [Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+MySQL], to include the setting, as how it has been mentioned in Confluence documentation.
fields.summary: Update connecting MySQL documentation to included transaction-isolation value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64177].
  {panel}

Hi,

This feature request (suggestion) is created because of issue JSP-281810 that I have created previously and for the moment, nothing exist that could answer our need.

We would like to have the possibility to filter only the subtasks that are open for a task, in a gadget (see printscreen : Printscreen1.png)

Thanks,

Marc-Albert
fields.summary: Filter a subtask column in a gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64175].
  {panel}

In other Change Management tools it is common to have 2 Databases:
 # Test Database (Staging Database)
 # Production Database

This allow to test changes to workflows, fields etc. prior for deploying them to the Production environment.

It will be very useful to have this ability in JIRA as well
fields.summary: Ability to test workflow changes on test environment before publishing to production
Component Mapping
Component Hub?
Release Link to Confluence
Component link to Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64168].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the prediction in the [Version report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Version+Report] is based on average velocity. Customer would want to be able to tweak these options

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer's comment:
{quote}
I'd like a way to either specify/override the velocity used in the prediction manually or for example, by having options for the velocity used for the release date prediction, e.g. with these options:
* average over version (current)
* average over last x weeks (where x is editable)
* average over last y sprints(where y is editable)
* manually tweakable number
{quote}

 
h3. Workaround 
-
fields.summary: Improve the Version Report
Expose callback interface that should be invoked by jira on issue modification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64166].
  {panel}

Hi,

I need to use the Windows high contrast theme white text on black background.
 The notification emails that I get from jira however have a hardcoded white background and text colours. Is there any way to turn this off?

See attached screenshot

At our company we have:
 * Atlassian JIRA [Project Management Software|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira] (v7.2.7#72009-sha1:68b7d86)
fields.summary: Jira notification emails don't support high contrast windows theme
Administrators should have the ability to restrict access to the System dashboard and the Browse Projects Page
